description: Manmade sounds such vehicle traffic can mask the positive impact of nature soundscapes on people's stress and anxiety, according to a new study.
title: Sound of traffic increases stress and anxiety, study finds

description: Contrary to widespread concerns that global crop yields have stagnated in recent decades, a comprehensive study of worldwide food production finds yields have continued to grow at roughly the same rate since the 1960s.
title: Global food yields have grown steadily during last six decades, study finds

description: People who have chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE) who have a family history of mental illness may have a higher risk of aggression in middle age, according to a new study.
title: For those with CTE, family history of mental illness tied to aggression in middle age

description: Large language models, a type of AI that analyses text, can predict the results of proposed neuroscience studies more accurately than human experts, finds a new study. The findings demonstrate that large language models (LLMs) trained on vast datasets of text can distil patterns from scientific literature, enabling them to forecast scientific outcomes with superhuman accuracy. The researchers say this highlights their potential as powerful tools for accelerating research, going far beyond just knowledge retrieval.
title: AI can predict study results better than human experts, researchers find

description: Brain size increased gradually within each ancient human species rather than through sudden leaps between species.
title: Brains grew faster as humans evolved

description: A new study represents a significant step forward in scientists' understanding of Alzheimer's disease. A team of investigators has examined the role of two proteins found in the brain and suggest the stability of their relationship to one another is crucial for memory formation and maintenance. Disruptions in this mechanical signalling pathway could lead to the disease. This is the first time this connection has been identified and could pave the way for therapeutic interventions.
title: New discovery could offer significant answers on Alzheimer's disease

description: Researchers have identified two fungal enzymes that hijack the immune system of plants, playing a critical role in the colonization of plant roots. These findings open new avenues for interventions in both medicine and agriculture.
title: How fungi colonize plant roots

description: Chimpanzees are known for their remarkable intelligence and use of tools, but could their cultures also evolve over time like human cultures? A new, multidisciplinary study suggests that some of their most advanced behaviors may have been passed down and refined through generations.
title: 'Genetic time machine' reveals complex chimpanzee cultures

description: Factors beyond carbohydrates have a substantial influence on blood glucose levels meaning current automated insulin delivery systems miss vital information required for glucose regulation, a new study has found.
title: No 'one size fits all' treatment for Type 1 Diabetes

description: The food additive carrageenan (E 407) can be responsible for the development of chronic inflammatory bowel disease, ulcers, and increased blood sugar levels in animals. Researchers have now investigated the effects of carrageenan on the human intestine and sugar metabolism. They found increased permeability of the small intestine, most likely due to intestinal inflammation.
title: Food additive carrageenan (E 407) could disrupt the intestinal barrier and increase the risk of type 2 diabetes, study finds

description: Researchers have investigated how cationic polymers organize on a molecular level when transporting RNA drugs.
title: Drug research: Decoding the structure of nano 'gene ferries'

description: If hunters continue to follow their current strategies and prey continue their same routine, turkeys may become tougher to harvest in the future, according to new research.
title: Fowl play: Why the hunt for Thanksgiving's favorite bird could get tougher

description: A team of physics educators is focusing on a new approach to teaching quantum physics in schools. Traditional classroom teaching has tended to focus on presenting the history of the origins of quantum physics, which often poses problems for learners. Using the quantum measurement process as an example, the researchers have now published their first empirical findings on learning quantum physics -- based on two-state systems.
title: Making quantum physics easier to digest in schools

description: A study has revealed that genetic variants associated with higher likelihood of rhythm impairments tended to be also associated with higher likelihood of dyslexia. The reverse was also the case: Genetic variants associated with more accurate musical rhythm skills co-occurred with genes linked to higher performance on language and reading tests, and to language-related educational outcomes.
title: Scientists discover shared genetic foundations between musical rhythm and human language

description: Chronic diseases such as diabetes are on the rise and are costly and challenging to treat. Scientists have discovered a common denominator driving these diverse diseases, which may prove to be a promising therapeutic target: proteolethargy, or reduced protein mobility, in the presence of oxidative stress.
title: Cellular traffic congestion in chronic diseases suggests new therapeutic targets

description: A new study identifies research strategies for tying brain function and structure to behavior and health.
title: New research points way to more reliable brain studies

description: A decade ago, researchers introduced a new model for studying Alzheimer's disease. Known as 'Alzheimer's in a dish,' the model uses cultures of mature brain cells suspended in a gel to recapitulate what takes place in the human brain over 10 to 13 years in just six weeks. But does the model truly produce the same changes that take place in patients? In a new study, researchers created an algorithm to assess, in an unbiased manner, how well models of Alzheimer's disease mimic the function and gene expression patterns seen in patients' brains. Their results identify crucial shared pathways, confirming that the Alzheimer's in a dish model can be used to assess new drugs accurately and rapidly as well as point the way to drug discovery.
title: 'Alzheimer's in dish' model shows promise for accelerating drug discovery

description: Cellular death is a fundamental concept in the biological sciences. Given its significance though, its definition depends on the context in which it takes place, and lacks a general mathematical definition. Researchers propose a new mathematical definition of death based on whether a potentially dead cell can return to a predefined 'representative state of living,' which are the states of being that we can confidently call 'alive.' The researchers' work could be useful for biological researchers and future medical research.
title: Researchers redefine what it means for a cell to be alive or dead

description: A fungus discovered in the mouse stomach may hold a key to fungal evolution within the gastrointestinal tract, according to new research. The finding suggests that preclinical studies until now have overlooked a major influencer of mouse physiology.
title: What a gut fungus reveals about symbiosis and allergy

description: Researchers found a reduction in cervical cancer mortality in women under the age of 25, which is likely due to the introduction of the HPV vaccine.
title: Cervical cancer deaths in young women plummet after introduction of HPV vaccine

description: Scientists create potential for genetic tools to control disease-spreading ticks.
title: Breakthrough could revolutionize future of tick control

description: In patients with long COVID, lower pulmonary gas exchange may be associated with impaired cognitive function, according to a new study.
title: Long COVID brain fog linked to lung function

description: A new study of high school football players found that concussions affect an often-overlooked but important brain signal.
title: Concussions slow brain activity of high school football players

description: A large new population study of men over 45 indicates insulin resistance may be an important risk factor for the development of the world's most common heart valve disease -- aortic stenosis (AS).
title: World's most common heart valve disease linked to insulin resistance in large national study
